description:
There are a few points I want to address in this review:

1. The controls are bad. You can tap your arrow keys with the exact same amount of force and get a different result in-game each time. This turns out to be pretty important since some levels have virtually zero room for error.

2. There are no menus, nor can you either close the game once opened, pause the game, save the game, or switch to another application without restarting your computer.

3. The design of the game looks like it was stolen from the 1990s.

summary: esta normal, y es mi infancia
